settings.title: Retail Stores Sales Supervisor - Madison, NY
settings.description:
We are seeking a Retail Stores Sales Supervisor to join our team and help us achieve objectives and revenue targets through excellence in every aspect of the customer lifecycle. In this position, you will be a brand ambassador and be an additional leader for all staff members. You will be responsible for maintaining merchandise and store appearance, as well as meeting and exceeding established individual as well as overall store sales goals. 

Responsibilities:

  • Displays business acumen by explaining key performance indicators (KPIs) to associates set forth by the Store Manager and contributing to the overall store sales goals.
  • Drives results by prioritizing selling while keeping associates focused
  • Ensuring exceptional customer service at all times by being an effective leader on the sales floor.
  • Focuses on the customer experience, develops customer loyalty, and cultivates repeat business.
  • Coach the sales team on performance and provide professional development
  • Coaching Sales Associates on the spot to give clear constructive feedback based on facts and observations
  • Identify associate training and implement action plans
  • Assist with Quarterly Inventory prep and execution
  • Communicate with Store Manager to ensure inventory meets the needs of the business.
  • Assist with merchandising the store and execute window displays to reflect latest collections
  • Assist with merchandising the store and execute window displays to reflect latest collections
  • Must be able to pick up 30-50lbs
  • Must be able to climb a ladder or stepstool

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years of Retail experience with at least 1 year management experience.
  • Effective communication skills and ability to provide feedback.
  • Must possess action-oriented skills and ability to lead by example on the sales floor.
  • Ability to prioritize, organize, and display effective time management skills.
  • Creates an environment of teamwork and collaboration.
  • Approachable and effective listener.
  • Displays problem solving abilities and willingness to think outside the box for solutions

Job Type: Full-time

Hourly: $23 - $25 DOE and 3% Commission

Schedule:

  • In Person- Must be able to work Saturday-Sunday
  • New York, NY 10075: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • 401(k)
  • Paid time off
  • Employee discount
  • Life insurance

If you are interested in joining our dynamic and collaborative team please submit your resume to both careers@lagence.com and mariela.polanco@lagence.com

settings.title: Operations & Customer Service Specialist - Commerce, CA (Hybrid)
settings.description:
We are seeking an Operations & Customer Service Specialist to join our team and help us achieve objectives and revenue targets through operational excellence not limited to the following areas: Order Management, Packaging, Returns, Inventory Planning, Warehouse Logistics, Systems. In this position you would collaborate closely with the warehouse, ecommerce, operational and finance teams to consistently exceed consumer expectations and grow our brand.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform daily e-commerce operational tasks: order management, returns + refunds, inventory planning; including allocations and transfers, and daily communication with warehouse and external parties to ensure operational excellence.
  • Evaluate operational procedures, including delivery performance issues – analyze data to communicate with management and report findings, and review processes to recommend best practices.
  • Track and report on fraud findings, including chargebacks, lost packages, and work with Finance Team to report order issues.
  • Maintain packaging supply levels in-office; placing reorders as needed.
  • Assist with warehouse operations matters and act as the liaison for communication with the warehouse and ecom/ marketing teams. 
  • Schedule quarterly meetings with warehouse team and outside vendors to discuss operational processes and new programs/technology.
  • Maintain operational procedures with 3rd party marketplaces.
  • Schedule weekly meetings with internal team to discuss any operational issues, improvements, new proposals, and fulfillment performance.
  • Develop and document workflows to streamline processes, including SOP.
  • Deliver exceptional customer service in a timely and professional manner, per our SLAs.
  • Assist with customer service operations matters working closely with Operations and Customer Service.
  • Assist in process improvement and documentation within the department.

Knowledge of:

  • Shopify Plus + Apps  ( Loop, Affirm, Paypal, Address Validator etc).
  • Global-e, or other cross boarder solution. 
  • ERP + WMS Systems (Full Circle).
  • Excel / PowerPoint etc. 
  • Gorgias or other helpdesk systems.
  • Google Tools.


Qualifications:

  • Ability to multitask and take on other departmental projects and initiatives.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with other departments.
  • Takes initiative and ownership of responsibilities.
  • Creative, collaborates & brings fresh ideas.
  • Accurate, detail-oriented, and organized.
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Acts with a sense of urgency, professionalism, and meets deadlines.
  • Positive attitude and team player – helps others in the department.

Job Type: Full-time

Hourly: $27 - $28 

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • 401(k)
  • Paid time off
  • Employee discount
  • Life insurance
  • Commuter benefits

If you are interested in joining our dynamic and collaborative team please submit your resume to ashley.bryan@lagence.com

settings.title: Global Brand Marketing Director (Hybrid, Los Angeles, CA)
settings.description:
Global Brand Marketing Director

We are seeking Global Brand Marketing Director to join our team and help us achieve objectives and revenue targets through excellence in every aspect of brand excellence. In this position, you would collaborate closely with the leadership team to develop and implement strategies, which consistently exceed consumer expectations and grow our brand.

• Oversee the brand deployment from message to experience across all media, online marketing, advertising, print, physical space, outdoor, and packaging.
• Develop and deploy Global PR and Communications strategy, manage in-house PR and agency. Ensure press focus is both strategic and sales-driving.
• Own presence across social channels, including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap Chat, and LinkedIn; evaluate and create launch strategies for other channels that could be favorable.
• Create the social editorial calendar and schedule all social media posts – both editorial and product focused.
• Build and engage the community, answer community questions, support L’AGENCE’s social media fans, and provide feedback to the L’AGENCE team.
• Own the strategy, vision, and execution of Influencer Marketing, micro-influencers, and key bloggers to build the brand and keep L’AGENCE top of mind.
• Build out and implement a strategy for talent/celebrity partnerships.
• Identify/drive growth in key target markets internationally.
• Manage the marketing needs of L’AGENCE’s retail partners, any co-op, and event management.
• Align the marketing calendar to maximize partner, social, and influencer activity.
• Partner with creative on events to maximize relationships and partnerships awareness.
• Define partner and social KPIs and create monthly and quarterly learnings and insights. Present quarterly reports to management on performance with clear action plans.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS
• Must be able to sit for long periods.
• Significant manual dexterity for keying in data for long periods.
• Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery.

Hybrid

Compensation - $135-175k

If you are interested in a career with L'AGENCE, please send your resume to careers@lagence.com for consideration.

settings.title: Senior Manager of CRM - (Hybrid, Los Angeles, CA)
settings.description:
We are seeking a Senior Manager of CRM to join our team and help us achieve objectives and revenue targets through excellence in every aspect of the customer lifecycle. In this position you would collaborate closely with the leadership team to develop and implement strategies, which consistently exceed consumer expectations and grow our brand.

Responsibilities
• End-to-end ownership of email, SMS and direct mail marketing campaigns, including strategy, planning, segmentation, execution, testing, deployment, analysis, and optimization across our client base.
• Direct accountability for retention marketing strategy and core KPIs for email, SMS and direct mail, by assessing list growth and engagement rates, LTV, and customer affinity metrics.
• Instill best practices into the email and retention programs, including automation, triggered campaigns, template development, dynamic content, personalization and retargeting.
• Plan and execute innovative email content strategies to constantly excite and entertain customers.
• Design customer rewards programs and develop segmentation framework.
• Lead the implementation and adoption of customer experience insight tools and data analytics.
• Deﬁne personalized customer journeys across the customer lifecycle and purchase cycle with the goal of driving better understanding, stronger customer engagement, and increased sales.
• Maintain a pulse on emerging technologies that could inﬂuence customer retention strategies.
• Prepare and present project hindsight analysis and recommendations to internal stakeholders and partner teams.
• Analyze and report on the efficacy of our retention marketing campaigns and develop reports that can be used to help continuously improve overall customer communications, relationships and acquisition.
• Develop a customer feedback program based on insight, surveys and reviews; track results and provide briefings to all departments.
• Work with Customer Care teams to provide VIP behavior insights and drive brand loyalty.
• Create and communicate customer profiles to educate stakeholders across the business.

Qualiﬁcations
• 5-7 years of experience in DTC retention marketing ideally within, fashion, beauty or CPG industries.
• Proven track record of running retention marketing programs with measurable results.
• Expert knowledge of direct-to-consumer eCommerce and retention marketing trends and best practices.
• Hands-on experience with at least one ESP and SMS platform and have created campaigns and automated/triggered programs within the technical capabilities of the platform. Klayvio preferred.
• Experience with Shopify ecosystem a plus.
• Experience setting up a CRM data warehouse a plus.
• Strong quantitative analytical ability and aptitude.
• Extensive experience managing A/B testing roadmap and a strong understanding of test setups and analyses.
• Strong project management, organization, prioritization, and communication skills with an attention to detail and the proven ability to build relationships and coordinate multiple projects across various teams.

Location: Hybrid, Los Angeles, CA

Compensation: $115,000

If you are interested in joining our dynamic and collaborative team please submit your resume to both careers@lagence.com and ashley.bryan@lagence.com.
